title: Soulful Bridge
opening: Soon after reclaiming the Fane of Raman, Marth's army fears pursuit from the Archanean army and escapes towards Chiasmir Bridge. However, a new enemy attacks the Altean army upon reaching the central islet.
"The Archanean army is coming from the north; we'll be surrounded like this."
The situation is desperate! Can Marth and his friends overcome the many perils?

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Huh? Kris, what's with the hat?

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: This? Lord Wendell gave it to me so that my cold wouldn't get any worse.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: From Lord Wendell, I see... Chiasmir Bridge has a strong sea wind, so it's good to have a hat to keep warm. It suits you, Kris.

intro.speaker: Cain
intro.line: Sire, you're safe! Kris! you too! You've guarded Prince Marth well.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: I'm truly glad that you came back unharmed, Cain.

intro.speaker: Cain
intro.line: Yeah, somehow I managed to shake off the enemy and escape here. But the enemy is already approaching from the north.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Don't worry. We will crush them.

intro.speaker: Cain
intro.line: No, not this time. Hardin is being protected by a mysterious power: we can't lay a finger on him. So even if we fight him now, we haven't a chance of winning. Please, head to the northwestern fortress. There's a boat across the river, which we can use to escape to the Khadein desert.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Sire, the free company to the south will probably make their move soon. Indeed, now's not the time to fight. For the time being, let's do as Cain suggests and make our escape. After that, we'll think of something...

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: I see... I don't like it, but we haven't a choice... Everyone, hurry to the northwest fortress!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: If ya ask me, archers'll always get along well with archers.

recruit-visit.speaker: Bantu
recruit-visit.line: Oh look, if it isn't Prince Marth. Long time no see, Lad. It seems so noisy out; I wonder what's happened?

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Ah, Bantu! Fancy meeting you in a place like this. How is Tiki?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bantu
recruit-visit.line: Oh, she is no longer by my side. Lord Gotoh took her to the Ice Dragon's Temple again.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: The Ice Dragon's temple? Where's that? I've never heard of such a place...

recruit-visit.speaker: Bantu
recruit-visit.line: It's in the icy lands, far north of here. But it's no place for humans. Besides the hero Anri, no man has been there yet.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Anri?! Are you, perchance, referring to the "Realm of the Gods" from Anri's legends?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bantu
recruit-visit.line: I'm not at liberty to say anything more. If you want to know more, you should ask Lord Gotoh. Anyhow, I have a favor to ask of you. My precious firestone was stolen by thieves. If you can get it back for me, I'll show you how it works. Thank you, Prince Marth.

battle.speaker: Hardin
battle.line: ...Hasten the preparations of the troops within the fortress. I want Marth cornered like a rat...

battle.speaker: Hardin
battle.line: Heh heh heh... Prince, your struggle is in vain. But let us continue this game for a while. Just know that you're fast running out of time. Soon, I will kill you myself...

battle.speaker: Hardin
battle.line: Heh heh heh... Prince Marth, it's been far too long.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Hardin... Why did you attack our country? What would compel you to do such an act? I... I can't believe this. Have you really changed this much?

battle.speaker: Hardin
battle.line: Prince, I am the ruler of this continent and the Emperor of Archanea. I will show no quarter to anyone who opposes me. That includes you, Prince... I must destroy this foul world... It is beyond salvation. Traitors, playtime is over. You will all die here. All soldiers, attack! Do not leave a single traitor standing!

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Good day, sir.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: Ack! You, y-you're... Caeda!

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Thank goodness, Roger. It's nice to see you again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: Uh... Uhm, you should know, I've no plans to betray Archanea. I was just thinking about that time when you asked me "do you believe in love?" But I'm different from who I was back then.

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Really? But you still seem like a nice man. That's why I wanted to speak with you again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: Uhh...

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: May I just ask, why are you fighting for Archanea?

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: Be-because Archanea has already taken over the world. Resistance is futile: no one can win. My life is precious to me. If I side with whoever's stronger, then I'm guaranteed to live longer...

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: I see.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: A-are you disappointed with me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: No, never. As I thought, you're fighting for what you believe in. You're not different. You're the same, kind man as when I first met you and I'm happy for that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: Uhhh... Wait- you're leaving?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Yes. I too must fight for what I believe in. But I'll make a request to Marth so that we don't have to fight you. I'm happy that we could talk again, Roger.

recruit-talk.speaker: Roger
recruit-talk.line: W-wait! ...As I thought, you're still very kind. Dare I say, we don't have girls quite like you back in Grust or Archanea. Um, perhaps... I suppose I could... Aw heck, I'm going with you again!

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: Wait, Sir Jeorge. I wish to speak with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: Prince Marth... Please, lower your weapon. I don't want to fight you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: I know. As do I. You taught Gordin how to use a bow. And you were an instructor to the junior knights of Altea. You've been a great boon to Altea: I could never fight you, Sir Jeorge.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: Prince... I pledge allegiance to Princess Nyna. But I can tolerate Hardin no longer... Taking other countries by force, executing "rebels" without reason...

recruit-talk.speaker: Marth
recruit-talk.line: ...Hardin was my friend. But he has changed beyond recognition. If he is committing any sort of crime, then I shall stop him. Jeorge, please, help me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: ...I understand, Prince. To return the kingdom of Archanea to what it was once before... I will take it upon myself to turn my bow against my homeland.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: Master! Please, wait!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: Hm...? Gordin? Long time no see. You seem to have gotten a little sturdier, but has your bow arm improved any?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: Yes, at the moment, I... They call me Altea's master of bows. It's thanks to you, Master, that I've been able to progress this far.

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: And? Did you come here because you wanted to challenge your old teacher?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: N-no! It's not like that... ...I might be asking the impossible, but I'd like you to fight alongside us again, sir.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: Please! Master!!

recruit-talk.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-talk.line: I pledged allegiance to Princess Nyna, but as for Hardin... I've had it with him. Taking other countries by force, executing "rebels" without reason. The Archanean army I see now is just a collection of hired thugs. There's not even a shred of chivalry left. To return the kingdom of Archanea to what it was once before... I must take it upon myself to turn my bow against my homeland. Gordin. Convey that to Prince Marth.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gordin
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Master!!

recruit-battle.speaker: Roger
recruit-battle.line: I don't want to fight you guys, but it's not as if I have a choice...

recruit-battle.speaker: Roger
recruit-battle.line: Ugh... I just wanted to meet her... once more... once more...

recruit-battle.speaker: Astram
recruit-battle.line: You traitors! I'll show you the might of Mercurius!!

recruit-battle.speaker: Jeorge
recruit-battle.line: You wouldn't have needed to die if you hadn't come so close, fools...

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: Rebel soldiers... Come to die, have you? I'll show you the terror of Gradivus!

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: Prince Marth! I'll bury you with these very hands!

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: Who are you? Your face is unknown to me.

boss.speaker: Kris
boss.line: Kris. I am Prince Marth's Royal Guard. Emperor Hardin of Archanea, the prince told me you were once a trusted friend. Why would you do something like this?

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: Kris, is it...? What does it matter to you? You will die here regardless.

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: Who are you? Your face is unknown to me.

boss.speaker: Kris
boss.line: Kris. I am Prince Marth's Royal Guard. Emperor Hardin of Archanea, I never knew you in the past. But I do know this: you are now the prince's enemy.

boss.speaker: Hardin
boss.line: You may come, Kris. But no one may even scratch me. You will soon know to fear... the power of the Darksphere...

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: I don't mind if you keep it for a little longer. Do you wish to give it back?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes. Thank you, it was most comfortable.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: No no, 'twas nothing. ...By the way, should I be hurrying too?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Erm... Yes, hurry up and escape!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: No... If it's all right with you, I'd like to hold on to it a little longer.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Yes, that would be splendid. ...By the way, should I be hurrying too?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Erm... Yes, hurry up and escape!
